Volunteer FAQs

  • Applying
  • Training
  • Other

  • Applying

  • How can I apply?
    Details about the application can be found here.
  • How many volunteers do you accept?
    We do not have a maximum cap for volunteers. If you are passionate about service and interested in learning more about taxes, we want you!
  • Do I have to be a particular major to apply?
    No, we accept all majors and minors, ranging from Business-Economics to Music Performance.
  • What if I have no experience working with taxes?
    No worries! We provide you all the necessary training during Fall or Winter quarter.

  • Training

  • When are the training dates?
    We have training most Tuesday and Sunday nights from 6 - 8 PM at designated locations.
  • Are presentation materials posted online?
    Yes, we try our best to post all of our training materials online for review shortly before the training date. Check your emails and/or the volunteer portal for updates!

  • Other

  • How can I become a QR if I am a returning volunteer?
    QR applications will be sent out to our official volunteers through email.
  • What is the time commitment?
    For Fall volunteers, the requirement is 12 hours for Winter and 9 hours for Spring quarter. For Winter volunteers, the requirement is 9 hours during the Winter and 9 hours during the Spring. For both Fall and Winter volunteers, you are required to complete at least 2 tax returns each quarter.
  • Are the info session slides posted online?
    Yes, the Fall 2019 info session slides can be accessed here.
